summary:
Yet another SQUID acronym:
SQUID, short for Surrogate Quantitative Interpretability for Deepnets, is a computational tool created by Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory (CSHL) scientists.  It’s designed to help interpret how AI models analyze the genome.  Compared with other analysis tools, SQUID is more consistent, reduces background noise, and can lead to more accurate predictions about the effects of genetic mutations...
title: Friday Squid Blogging: SQUID Is a New Computational Tool for Analyzing Genomic AI

summary: I love, love, love the idea Jedda is proposing and asking us to all join in on, with her post today about Community Echoes.  Which is a kind of footnote beneath our posts to indict if our posts has been inspired by, or has inspired others to blog on a certain theme or topic.  It's a fun idea to not only acknowledge other people blogs and posts, but share them with the community...
title: Echoing the Community

summary:
Consumer Reports has a new study of people-search site removal services, concluding that they don’t really work:
As a whole, people-search removal services are largely ineffective.  Private information about each participant on the people-search sites decreased after using the people-search removal services.  And, not surprisingly, the removal services did save time compared with manually opting out...
title: People-Search Site Removal Services Largely Ineffective
